Opsoclonus-Myoclonus Syndrome.Definition: A neurological condition that is characterized by uncontrolled rapid irregular movements of the eye ( OPSOCLONUS) and the muscle ( MYOCLONUS) causing unsteady, trembling gait. It is also known as dancing eyes-dancing feet syndrome and is often associated with neoplasms, viral infections, or autoimmune disorders involving the nervous system (MeSH).
